title: OAuth 2.0 Authentication Setup
content: To configure OAuth 2.0 authentication in Elasticsearch 9.x, use the new security API. Navigate to Stack Management > Security and enable OAuth provider. The modern approach uses API-driven configuration rather than file-based settings.
content_snippet: Configure OAuth 2.0 in Elasticsearch 9.x using the security API via Stack Management > Security.

title: OAuth Token Management
content: Manage OAuth tokens programmatically via the /_security/oauth2/token endpoint. Tokens can be refreshed and revoked using the API. This replaces the legacy token management approach.
content_snippet: Manage OAuth tokens via /_security/oauth2/token endpoint for refresh and revocation.

title: OAuth Security Best Practices
content: Best practices for OAuth in Elasticsearch 9.x include using short-lived tokens, enabling PKCE for public clients, and configuring proper redirect URIs. Always validate the state parameter.
content_snippet: OAuth best practices: short-lived tokens, PKCE, proper redirect URIs, state validation.

title: OAuth Provider Configuration
content: Configure external OAuth providers like Okta, Azure AD, or Auth0 through the security API. Elasticsearch 9.x supports OpenID Connect protocol natively with automatic discovery.
content_snippet: Configure Okta, Azure AD, Auth0 via security API with OIDC auto-discovery.

title: OAuth Troubleshooting Guide
content: Common OAuth issues in 9.x and their solutions. Check token expiration, validate redirect URIs match exactly, and verify client credentials. Use the _security/oauth2/debug endpoint for diagnostics.
content_snippet: Troubleshoot OAuth: check token expiration, redirect URIs, credentials, use debug endpoint.

title: OAuth Authentication Configuration
content: Configure OAuth using the legacy realm settings in elasticsearch.yml. Add xpack.security.authc.realms.oidc configuration block. This file-based approach requires cluster restart.
content_snippet: Configure OAuth via elasticsearch.yml with xpack.security.authc.realms.oidc settings.

title: OAuth Realm Setup
content: Add oauth realm to xpack.security.authc.realms.oidc.my-oidc. Configure op.issuer, op.authorization_endpoint, and op.token_endpoint manually in the configuration file.
content_snippet: Set up OAuth realm in xpack.security.authc.realms.oidc with op.* settings.

title: OAuth Client Registration
content: Register OAuth clients by adding rp.client_id and rp.client_secret to your elasticsearch.yml configuration file. Secrets should be stored in the Elasticsearch keystore.
content_snippet: Register OAuth clients via rp.client_id and rp.client_secret in elasticsearch.yml.

title: OAuth Role Mapping
content: Map OAuth claims to Elasticsearch roles using role_mappings.yml. Configure claim patterns for automatic role assignment based on user attributes from the identity provider.
content_snippet: Map OAuth claims to roles via role_mappings.yml with claim patterns.

title: OAuth Session Management
content: Configure session settings in elasticsearch.yml including session.timeout and token.refresh settings for OAuth realms. Sessions are managed server-side.
content_snippet: Configure OAuth sessions via session.timeout and token.refresh in config file.

title: Setting Up OAuth (Deprecated)
content: Use the shield plugin to configure OAuth authentication. Install shield and configure shield.authc settings. Note: Shield has been replaced by X-Pack security.
content_snippet: Configure OAuth via Shield plugin (deprecated, replaced by X-Pack).

title: Shield OAuth Configuration
content: Configure shield.authc.oauth settings in elasticsearch.yml. The shield plugin handles all OAuth token validation and session management.
content_snippet: Set shield.authc.oauth settings for OAuth token validation.

title: OAuth Token Validation
content: Shield validates OAuth tokens against configured providers. Set shield.authc.oauth.token_validation.endpoint in config to point to your OAuth provider.

title: Shield Security Settings
content: Enable OAuth in Shield by setting shield.authc.oauth.enabled: true. Configure callback URLs in shield.authc.oauth.callback for redirect handling.
content_snippet: Enable OAuth: shield.authc.oauth.enabled: true with callback URLs.

title: Legacy OAuth Migration
content: Guide for migrating from Shield OAuth to native X-Pack security. Shield is deprecated in favor of X-Pack which provides the same functionality with better integration.
content_snippet: Migrate from Shield to X-Pack security for OAuth functionality.
